meanings.sent1: She imbibed the refreshing lemonade on a hot day.

meanings.sent3: The thirsty puppy imbibed the water in one gulp.

meanings.definition: To absorb or soak up (knowledge or information)
meanings.sent1: The curious student imbibed all the facts from the textbook.
meanings.sent2: She imbibed the wisdom of her elders over the years.
meanings.sent3: The detective imbibed the clues like a sponge.
meanings.sent4: His mind imbibed the lessons of history effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The young scientist imbibed the research findings, eager to learn more.
